column2: 1. This sign indicates the _______________ vehicles can safely travel in this area.
2. A thumping sound can be a warning:
column8: that a tire blowout is about to occur.

column2: 3. This traffic sign warns you about:
column8: a hill or a downgrade up ahead on the road.

column2: 4. When they see a crossbuck sign, drivers:
column4: are legally required to yield the right of way to trains.
column6: must always come to a complete stop.
column10: must slow down and wait for the red lights to flash.

column4: the overpass ahead has a low clearance.
column8: the maximum width of a vehicle allowed on the highway.
column10: the maximum legal height allowed in this State.

column2: 6. When getting ready to change lanes, you should:
column4: quickly turn your head to check for other vehicles.

column2: 7. When approaching a curve, remember to:
column4: drive at the posted speed limit throughout the curve.
column6: slow down before entering the curve.
column8: accelerate slightly before entering the curve.
column10: drive at the posted speed limit as you enter the curve, then slow down gradually.

column2: 8. Which statement about drinking alcohol and driving is true?
column4: Alcohol affects judgement and coordination, which are needed to drive safely.
column6: If you are under the legal BAC limit, your driving is not affected.
column8: After drinking, a cold shower will sober you up.

column6: Drivers who are driving on long, boring roads.

column2: 10. This road sign warns drivers that:
column6: they are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column10: the one-way street or roadway is about to change to two-way traffic.

column2: 11. The amount of alcohol in the blood is measured by:
12. If you stop at a railroad crossing with more than one track:
column4: proceed with caution until you see a train.
column6: go through when one of the tracks is free.
column8: wait until you have a clear view of both tracks.
column10: go through as soon as the first train passes.

column2: 13. When driving in work zones you should:
column6: gradually come to a complete stop and wait for a flagger to guide traffic safely through the work zone.
column8: carefully watch for workers and moving equipment.

column2: 14. Your driving ability can be affected by:

column4: Double curve ahead. Slow your speed.
column6: The road may be slippery when wet. Drive slowly.
when it first starts to rain.

column2: 18. This sign is a warning that you are approaching:
19. What is the meaning of orange traffic signs?
column6: Stop, do not enter or wrong way.
column10: Warning of school, pedestrian, and bicycling activity.

column6: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.
column10: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.

column8: Go. The light will soon be red.
column10: If the way is clear, you may move forward slowly without stopping.

column2: 24. Which of the following must you obey over the others?

column4: you should keep your eyes moving.
column6: your tires do not have as much traction.
column8: you should use cruise control to increase traction.

column6: try to pass them as they have different braking capabilities than other motor vehicles.
column8: keep less space in front of their vehicle.
column10: keep more space in front of their vehicle.

column2: 27. Pentagonal signs are used to indicate:
28. What should drivers do when they see this road sign?
column4: increase their speed to cross the intersection before a train arrives.
column6: come to a complete stop and wait for a train to cross.
column10: slow down, look for a train, and be prepared to stop.

column2: 29. Which statement about blind spots is true?
column4: If traffic conditions permit you should cruise in blind spot of the vehicle ahead.
column6: Before changing lanes, you should check mirrors and look over your shoulder toward the rear.
column8: Large trucks have smaller blind spots than most passenger vehicles.

column4: You can pass other vehicles and change lanes, if it is safe.
column6: You can change lanes, but only when traffic conditions or obstructions in the road make it necessary.
column8: You can not pass other vehicles or go across the line.

column4: allow at least 4 seconds of following distance.
column6: allow a following distance of at least 2 car lengths.
column8: allow at least 2 seconds of following distance.
column10: allow a following distance of at least 4 motorcycle lengths.

column6: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that the driver cannot see with use of mirrors.
column8: At night, the darkest areas of a road, where emergency flashers should be used.
column10: Dangerous intersection where the maximum speed limit is 15 MPH or less.
